text: Specimen labeled 'left breast mass' consists of fibrofatty tissue.
Microscopic examination reveals invasive lobular carcinoma.
Nottingham Histologic Grade: 2 (Tubule 3, Nuclear 2, Mitotic 1).
Tumor size is 1.8 cm in greatest dimension.
Estrogen Receptor (ER): Positive (95%, strong intensity).
Progesterone Receptor (PR): Negative (<1%).
HER2/neu status: Equivocal (2+) by IHC.
FISH amplification shows HER2/CEP17 ratio of 2.5.
Margins are negative for invasive carcinoma.
Closest margin is 0.2 cm from the posterior aspect.
Lymphovascular invasion is identified.
Ductal Carcinoma In Situ (DCIS) of solid type is present.
Ki-67 proliferation index is high (45%).
Sentinel lymph node 1: Negative for malignancy (0/1).
Sentinel lymph node 2: Metastatic carcinoma (3mm focus).
Extranodal extension is not identified.
Background breast tissue shows fibrocystic changes.
Consistent with primary breast origin.
P53 immunohistochemistry is positive.
Diagnosis: Fibroadenoma, benign.
